DataElement.preferredName: Isolation Infection Control Practice Occurrence Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day and year isolation with infection control practice occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A state of separation; the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements._A set of precautions used to prevent transmission of diseases that can be acquired by person to person or person to environment contact with blood, body fluids, non-intact skin (including rashes), and mucous membranes. These include standard precautions used for all patient care, consisting of risk assessment, common sense practices, and the use of personal protective equipment, as well as transmission-based precautions used with patients who may be infected or colonized with certain infectious agents for which additional precautions are needed to prevent infection transmission._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A state of separation; the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.

Concepts.definition: A state of separation; the act of isolating something; setting something apart from others; marked by separation of or from usually contiguous elements.

Property.preferredDefinition: A set of precautions used to prevent transmission of diseases that can be acquired by person to person or person to environment contact with blood, body fluids, non-intact skin (including rashes), and mucous membranes. These include standard precautions used for all patient care, consisting of risk assessment, common sense practices, and the use of personal protective equipment, as well as transmission-based precautions used with patients who may be infected or colonized with certain infectious agents for which additional precautions are needed to prevent infection transmission.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: A set of precautions used to prevent transmission of diseases that can be acquired by person to person or person to environment contact with blood, body fluids, non-intact skin (including rashes), and mucous membranes. These include standard precautions used for all patient care, consisting of risk assessment, common sense practices, and the use of personal protective equipment, as well as transmission-based precautions used with patients who may be infected or colonized with certain infectious agents for which additional precautions are needed to prevent infection transmission.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
